page.title: 12All Hallows Community
page.content: In 1859 the community opened its House of Mercy in Ditchingham followed three years later, by a school, originally for orphans. All Hallows Hospital opened in 1873 and is still giving service over 100 years later. All Hallows Junior School moved to its present site in 1960 and became part of the larger All Hallows School. In 1975, St. Anne's Old People's Home was opened next to the Hospital. {WORK TODAY: Hospital}- care of elderly sick, and terminally ill, surgery {Convent}- Mother House, 2 guest houses St. Michael's conference centre, All Hallows School {Norwich}- Church of Mother Julian, Guest House, short stay home for women and girls. The community consists of 22 sisters, 3 novices and 1 postulant.
